content.description: Find yourself with just enough room for the right hand finger tips in the first slot hold The sit start requires some strength and tricky feet to figure out which lead into a short finessed foot-puzzle before the top out. DONT BREAK THE FLAKE even it does feel satisfying to hold. Stand start with some slotted hold probably a V2.
content.protection: 1 big pad. Maybe one on the adjacent rock.
content.location: To the right of The North Rememberers. You’ll identify a slabby face and it’s bellybutton. That will be the right hand start hold. Left hand is pressing on the crescent. It’s in great chill spot off the trail protected by a shorter rock.

content.description: It is a very obvious, self explanatory squeeze chimney. Crux appeared to be reaching the large jug rail about mid way up the route.Unsure if this is a FA or not. Did not find any info about it on this site or in the most recent guide book and I know offwidth is not as common around here, however, such an obvious line has most likely been done, so any info would be appreciated. Gave it a name for the sake of putting it on the site.
content.protection: No good place for pads. Stay deep in it if you can
content.location: Offwidth squeeze chimney about 10 yards right of "No Way Out"

content.description: Sit start at the bottom of the flaring crack. Climb hands, to fists, to offwidth as the flare widens. Squeeze the hips in for the top out and walk off the easy slab. Gave it a name for the sake of posting, but did not see any info in the old guidebook. If anyone has more info about this crack please comment. It is an obvious and beautiful line.
content.protection: Pads. Helpful to place one vertically against the opposite wall.
content.location: From Levitation Layback, look climber's right. This is the crack in the back corner of the alley.

content.description: One the backside of the obviously elephant shaped boulder- find a left hand sloper and right hand slopey crimp and low feet to start...traverse right & move upwards to the left hand side press and ride the rump to top out
content.location: North Mountain area on the elephant boulder

content.description: Crux is near the top. Head up the layback and crack, then left to jams. Continue up and left for the top out. Originally climbed with a top rope, then lead with pro before bouldering (solo).
content.protection: Standard rack, sucks up pro if you are not the bouldering type.
content.location: Just west of the Bed of Moss Boulder, past the hallway between the rocks and look for the obvious crack heading up and left. Head down the backside or jump over to an easier walk down.

content.description: Sit start in good hands, working up and left until the crack zig zags. After the zig zag, crawl up the ramp with fists/hands deep in the flaring, body-sized offwidth.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Useful to slide the pad along while climber advances up the ramp
content.location: This is on the back side of the "Zorro Boulder", according to the old guide book. Refer to map picture for more info. If looking at Thurmond Slab, the giant rock behind you is the Zorro Boulder.

content.description:
Follow the crack up with bad feet to a slightly better layback hold before the committing finish to the rail. 

  v5 with a sit start.
Start on high knob and move straight up.
content.location: When you get off the trail you come to a kind of hallway, it's the first boulder on the eastern side, climb in the middle of the face.

content.description: A good number of problems here. Most are v2 and below but there are a few projects(scattered) and harder problems(which all utilize mono's).
